DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Personal Medical History Or Symptom Severe Sinus Bradycardia Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether patient has medical history or symptom(s) of severe sinus bradycardia.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Personal Medical History Or Symptom Severe Sinus Bradycardia
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent._A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of abnormally slow heart rate with its origin in the sinus node. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Or Symptom Severe Sinus Bradycardia
Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.:A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of abnormally slow heart rate with its origin in the sinus node. Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

A disorder characterized by an electrocardiographic finding of abnormally slow heart rate with its origin in the sinus node. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
